required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Dietary Carbohydrate and Fat Availability in the Regulation of Hepatic Lipid Content
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Dietary Carbohydrate and Fat Availability in the Regulation of Hepatic Lipid Content

collaborator.agency: Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate dietary compositions effect on liverfat measured by magnetic resonance imaging.

detailed_description.textblock:
Overweight but otherwise healthy men will be included in the study which is a randomized diet intervention study in a cross over design.
The study involves 2 intervention periods of 5 days each, during which the participant ingests two different types of experimental diet. Participants will in randomized order (determined by block randomization) ingest a diet with low carbohydrate and high fat content, and a diet with high carbohydrate and low fat content.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized diet intervention study in a cross over design

primary_outcome.time_frame: (MRS Day -1 (before intervention starts), Day 5 (after diet intervention is completed)
primary_outcome.description: The effect of high-carbohydrate/low-fat vs low-carbohydrate/high-fat diet on change in MRS determined liver fat.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: (MRS Day -1 (before intervention starts), Day 5 (after diet intervention is completed)
secondary_outcome.description: effect of the low-carbohydrate/high-fat intake and high-carbohydrate/low-fat intake on hepatic glycogen content measured by 7T 13C-MRS

secondary_outcome.time_frame: (Day 0 and Day 6 of the diet intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Ra of glucose= (infusion rate of 6,6 2H2-glucose)/TTR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: (Day 0 and Day 6 of the diet intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin clearance determined during steady state insulin infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: (Day 0 and Day 6 of the diet intervention)

intervention.description: The participants will be randomized to a diet of low carb/ high fat og high carb/low fat
The participants will be randomized to a diet of low carb/ high fat og high carb/low fat

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men being 18-50 years old.
- Overweight (BMI 25-35)
- Low to moderate physical activity level, defined as ≤ 1 weekly session of aerobic exercise.
- Non-smokers
- No use of medicine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fasting blood glucose indicating overt diabetes (≥7 mmol/l)
- HbA1C >48 mmol/mol
- Fasting plasma triacylglycerol indicating dyslipidemia (≥2.2 mmol/l)
- FIB-4 score >1.45
- Contraindications for MR-scan: abdominal height exceed limitations of the MR-scanner, pacemaker or other electronic device implanted, implanted metal devices, severe claustrophobia.
